TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides minimal design-time support for controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner class is identical to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerDesigner> class and provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> controls. It appears on the design surface as a plain gray box showing the name of the class and the ID of the specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> control. You can change the rendering of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in the same manner as with any standard <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is overridden to always return `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an empty string (""), which indicates that the visual design environment should revert to default control rendering.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: The control associated with the designer.
Docs.summary: Binds the designer to the associated control.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.
